content.description: This is a decent traverse on nice rock. Climb R->L a couple of feet off the ground, the crux is at the end.
content.location: At the main park entrance off Route 85, go left at the fork about 100 yards, and the boulder will be on the right about 50' off the road.

content.description: This is a bit high, but...it has nice rock on the Elephant Boulder. It takes the corner around the right side.
content.location: From the main gate, go left on the paved road for 15 minutes to a big grey/white boulder on the left, a bit hard to see, about 50 yards off the road. It's on a trail, but I forget what the name is.

content.description: This is the easy route on the Elephant. It takes the blunt arete facing the road. PIED is kind of easy, but a fall could be ugly.
content.protection: May be a bolt on top.
content.location: As per Trunk, it is on the large Elephant Boulder.

content.description: Start on a very thin arete with a pinch on the left hand.  Move right heel around right and settle in a shallow divot.  Rock onto heel reach high with right hand to a very bad, sloping, sidepull-type hold.  Move left up high and bump right up to a better side pull and then pull on top.  The crux is moving the right heel over as it is hard to stay on.
content.location: From the park HQ on Cedar Street, find the Chipmunk Trail on the the right side of parking lot.  Follow the trail till you find a boulder right on the trail.  Bushwhack left into the woods following a slight rise till you see the boulder.

content.description: Start just to the left of Black Carpet Ride.  Climb straight up through the small horizontal halfway up.  Walk right to anchor for Black Carpet Ride.
content.protection: Small cam for first overlap, small nut for small horizontal.
content.location: Just to the left of Black Carpet Ride, climb straight up through the small horizontal to the top.

content.description: This is a nice, short route on perfect rock.
content.location: Behind the park HQ, wind through a short trail (lookout/ledges) till atop the slab - 5 minutes. Descend to the right or rap in. This is located above the pond.

content.description:
This is a nice park with swimming, fishing, easy mountain biking, and some climbing. There is a small entrance fee in summer, but it is free the rest of the time. 

  There are two boulders and a 35' slab behind park HQ and a big boulder on the main park road. They are of excellent quality.
